measured_by: statcheck R package (automated extraction and re-computation of NHST results)
justification: “We assessed the consistency of the reported statistical results through an automated procedure: an adapted version of the R package ‘statcheck’ …” indicating that the construct was operationalized with the statcheck tool.
The paper explains that “incongruent p-values that possibly change the statistical conclusion … are marked as a gross inconsistency,” a specific output category generated by statcheck.

“‘Open Practice Badges’ is a collective term for three types of badges… This simple intervention has proven to be very effective,” showing the badges were used as indicators of engaging in open practices.
For Study 3 the authors “focused on the Open Data Badges in specific,” treating possession of an Open Data Badge as the measure of whether the article shared its data.

measured_by: manual coding of published data files in article or repository
justification: Throughout the studies “for each article, we coded whether the (raw) data were available… Published data files… were considered open data,” describing a systematic coding procedure used to measure data availability.
